rename.from: [FR] Fix the first row (title row) of mlflow UI
rename.to: [FR] Freeze the first row (title row) of mlflow UI

body: @Jingnan-Jia Thank you for raising this issue! I completely agree that this is necessary for a good user experience. I've added the `good first issue` and `help wanted` labels in hopes of soliciting a contribution.
@sunishsheth2009 Do you know how we can fix this?
Hey @harupy and @dbczumar we already have a fix for this and will be merged soon by Hubert. Lets wait for his fix to be merged soon. :)

Another related feature should be: Make it possible to scroll right/left without the need to scroll down to the bottom.

In the following image, at present when I want to check more metrics (outsied the "screen") of the current runs, I have to 1. scroll down to the bottom to get the horizontal bar, then 2. press and hold the horizontal bar to the left/right, and then 3. scroll up to the specific runs to see more metrics.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/34941987/166301674-a3415bfb-085c-462c-bb70-6d74a4491af8.png)

So I hope that there should be another set of seperate horizontal bar and vertical bar for the experiments/runs, so that we can see move the bars to see the column titles all the time and see more parameters/metrics easily.

@Jingnan-Jia @sunishsheth2009 
PR containing fixed header row is here
https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/pull/5818
Example: 

![May-06-2022 17-55-27](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/104438646/167168895-1e8df585-7b9b-46d5-b951-c4e20cc22ec6.gif)

Regarding https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/issues/5789#issuecomment-1115211507 comment:
It is possible to scroll horizontally by using trackpad or shift+wheel (while hovering the scrollable area). The horizontal scroll position will be reflected correctly in the fixed header. We can try to find a way to display the horizontal scrollbar itself on the bottom of the viewport, it might be non-trivial through.

@hubertzub-db Thanks very much! That looks wonderful!

Can yo tell me how to use the new feature? Should I download monai again using `pip install mlflow`? Or should I download its Nightly snapshots (I still do not know how to download its nightly version)?
